intro: Oberna alpina, commonly known as the alpine oberna, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine meadows, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is often found in high-altitude environments. Oberna alpina plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is a symbol of the unique biodiversity of alpine ecosystems.
